programme.title: Undercover Wife
programme.desc: A forensic accountant goes under cover when her husband, an FBI agent, is slain by a criminal cartel.

programme.title: Virtual Lies
programme.desc: A woman discovers that her husband is having an online affair, but even as he attempts to correct his past, his online acquaintance won’t quit.

programme.title: We Have Your Husband
programme.desc: After her husband Eduardo is kidnapped near their ranch in Mexico, Jayne has to raise enough money to ransom him back.

programme.title: Who Killed My Husband?
programme.desc: A widowed police officer goes under cover to solve the same case that got her husband killed.

programme.title: Twisted Sister
programme.desc: Emily's husband, Kyle, starts acting strange after a woman named Lily shows up on their doorstep claiming to be her half sister. When Emily is suddenly poisoned, Kyle blames Lily -- but Emily becomes suspicious that Kyle may be the culprit.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Geoffrey Evans and his accomplice John Shaw hit headlines in 1976 after the murders of two women in Ireland.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Dayton Leroy Rogers, known as The Molalla Forest Killer, is a serial killer who mutilates and kills at least eight women.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Catherine Nevin reports a break-in and violent attack at her pub, which leaves her husband dead.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: A jailing for the shocking murder of author Helen Bailey leads to a second conviction of another.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: The story of a killer who was infamous for his whimpering confessions over the phone after each of his murders.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Pawel Relowicz rapes and kills 21-year-old Hull student Libby Squire in a case that made headlines around the UK.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: A fugitive from the United States tackles the British police and goes on the run.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: The story of Mark Martin, who murdered three women in his quest to become Nottingham's first serial killer.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer afternoon in upscale Lodi, California, a 12-year-old girl is abducted from her home. Scores of police officers and FBI agents converge, determined to find the young girl before it is too late. When the kidnapper's car is discovered in a field near Lodi, police dogs, helicopters, and hundreds of volunteers are employed in a round-the-clock search. It would take a community united in concern for one of their youngest to find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1970's, Otpor, a violent arm of the Croatian National Resistance commits terroristic acts against non-supportive Croatians living in the U.S. With the help of an informant, the FBI is able to apprehend, arrest and convict members of the group for crimes ranging from conspiracy and extortion to murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In rural Texas, 13-year-old is kidnapped on her way to school. Frantic to find her safely, her millionaire father calls local authorities and the FBI. As police officers and agents conduct aerial surveillance, the father drives hundreds of miles through the night to deliver the ransom cash to a drop that the kidnappers keep changing. In a final effort to save the young girl, investigators must engage in a dangerous firefight with five desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 12, 1997, two men use a sledgehammer to break into a Camden, NJ home. The homeowner shoots at the intruders, hitting one in the hand before they escape. Camden Police respond and track the suspects to a nearby park. One of the men shoots at the officer before police arrest his accomplice. The man gives up the identity of the shooter. Twice, police stake out homes where they believe the shooter is hiding, but he eludes them.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Henderson, NV, a suburb of Las Vegas, two robbers brandishing assault rifles ambush armored guards as they exit their truck on March 3, 2000. The robbers kill both guards and seize $5,000. As the killers run to their getaway car, a police officer arrives and opens fire, striking one escaping assailant in the leg. After loosing the killers in a chase, police collect blood left by the injured robber and bullet casings from the firefight.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In February 1988, a record store clerk in Sandusky, Ohio, was fatally shot in his van. After discovering a night deposit bag with thousands of dollars in the vehicle, police knew that robbery was not the motive, and began to investigate other possibilities. FBI agents learned that several motorcycle gang members had been stopped nearby on a traffic violation shortly after the murder and theorized that the clerk's murder may have been a botched hit carried out by a gang member.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1980s, the drug trade ravages Chicago's inner city neighborhoods and violent crime threatens to destroy entire communities. As drug profits grow, gangs rule the streets. One of the most dangerous is the El Rukns. FBI Agents team up with state and local police to bring them down, but in the process, uncover a bizarre and frightening terrorist plot.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: In April 1997, 27-year-old Rachel McGrath is stabbed to death by an unknown attacker in a car park.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Geoffrey Evans and his accomplice John Shaw hit headlines in 1976 after the murders of two women in Ireland.

programme.title: Killers: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A couple are found dismembered in their own home, and a woman is found dead after being stalked by a stranger.

programme.title: Killers: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A young woman is stalked, but her cry for help is ignored. An estranged husband threatens to kill his wife.

programme.title: Killers: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A sister tracks down her brother's killer, and CCTV is the main witness to identify the killer of a mother.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: Omar Murray worked hard to give wife Alisha everything she wanted. But it wasn’t enough, and Alisha decided he was worth more dead.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: Sana Muhammad escaped an arranged marriage and found true happiness with a new man. Until her ex-husband began hunting her down.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: The murder of former NBA star and hometown hero Lorenzen Wright sends shockwaves through the city of Memphis; insiders speak out about new developments in the lengthy search for justice.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: When the death of a 59-year-old father is found to be unrelated to his ongoing health issues, police begin an investigation and question some of his family members.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: When police investigate the shooting death of a man who was in bed with his wife, they discover a complex case with two suspects.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: An aspiring Playboy model is brutally murdered in Miami after visiting a nightclub with her boyfriend.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: During a weekend away, a longtime married couple go on an afternoon hike that ends in tragedy; a multitude of evidence makes the mystery hard to untangle.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: When Cara Ryan shoots her ex-husband and accuses him of threatening to kill her, police question her motive.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Doctors cannot pinpoint the source of a businessman's illness.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder¾_ that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How scientists solved a 1992 murder case involving cremation. It takes a long time and a very hot fire to cremate a human body, and thus destroy evidence of foul play. But the coroner who performed the autopsy on the body found telltale clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The police investigate when a severed leg is discovered in the garbage. Conventional means of identifying the victim are impossible, leading investigators to rely on DNA, forensic anthropology and toxicology to identify the victim.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An examination of the 2002 DC area shooting spree that resulted in ten murders.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An Alaskan police officer found a woman's body while on routine patrol of a public park. The victim had been stabbed to death and, during the autopsy, the medical examiner preserved the portion of her rib cage which sustained the fatal wound.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1999, a 12-year-old was found murdered in her home and it changed the feeling of security residents had in the small town of Waseca, Minnesota. Despite a meticulous search of the home and an exhaustive investigation, police had no suspects.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1988, the body of a young woman was discovered in an Ohio river. Most of the evidence had been washed away, but the victim's 6 year-old son unwittingly told investigators all they needed to know...without saying a word. The clue was in his genes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A talented television news anchor was shot to death outside her home; it appeared to be a crime of passion, perpetrated by an obsessed fan.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An unusual case involving the 1988 rape and murder of Nancy DePriest. After Chris Ochoa confessed, the case was closed. 8 years later, Achim Marino confessed to the same crime. DNA evidence cleared Ochoa while proving that Marino was the perpetrator.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In an affluent suburb of Philadelphia, police were called to the scene of what appeared to be an accidental drowning. The investigation gradually focused on one person, a suspect who had more than a million reasons to want the victim dead.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An employee of a dry cleaner was raped and murdered in the store. Police turned to forensic science for the answers they needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation of the kidnapping of a prominent banker's wife led police on a wild goose chase. An unexpected discovery made by an entomologist led to a new suspect, and the realization that ordinary office equipment can leave extraordinary clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: 1984 Rajneeshee bioterror attack: investigators uncover a plot to overthrow the government after a unique strain of salmonella makes people ill.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1987 disappearance of Houston resident Tracy Jo Shine is recalled. The investigation went cold until 2000 when a 'cold case squad' learned that the woman's ex-boyfriend Michael Neal had bragged about killing her.

programme.title: Killer Mistake
programme.desc: Uncover a wife’s secret tormenter and the cycle of abuse that ended in murder.

programme.desc: Look inside the toxic relationship between a teen and her violent boyfriend.

programme.desc: Analyze a random tip that leads cops to arrest a husband for his wife’s murder.

programme.title: Killer Mistake

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe

programme.title: Good Day DC
programme.desc: FOX 5's Good Day DC team breaks down the latest local, regional and national news.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: In McKees Rocks, Ed and Day examine the power of community service. The guys experience what it’s like to be a volunteer firefighter, bread maker, and full-service entertainer.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: In Kansas City, local notables Shawn Barber, Charlie Hustle and Nikki Vivas tell you why you need to suit up for electro-muscle stimulation, where to target a good time with ax throwing and how to find an underground speakeasy.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Master bartender Kate Gerwin visits Kansas City to talk whiskey, taste the nonalcoholic future at an innovative new bar, experience jazz at the Mutual Musicians Foundation, and learn all about Prohibition in the city that ignored it best.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: Indulge in the old-school classics that have reigned in the Midwest for decades. From Wisconsin cheese curds to Kansas City's burnt ends, enjoy these unique comfort foods that are as timeless as they are tasty.

programme.title: Lowrider Legacy
programme.desc: Lowrider Legacy follows celebrated lowrider families, scholars, and activists and documents the history of resistance on wheels that has defined lowrider culture.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Can Chef Colton Colburn-Wood of Cosmica in Boston trip up Chef Erin Miller of Urban Hearth in Cambridge? Both chefs skillfully build simple to complex foundations. But who will correctly replicate and get theirs plated in time?

programme.title: Always Remember Your Name
programme.desc: A documentary of mistaken identity, hope, love, and the power of story by two Holocaust survivors.

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented “for the picking.” From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: From ice hockey to lacrosse to tennis, Baltimore coaches help drive the next generation to find family, inspiration and pride through sports.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: World-renown maestro Edvard Tchievzel makes a harrowing escape from the USSR to bring his talent and skills to Greenville, where he leads the orchestra into a new era.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find an oyster farm shucking expectations, Maine traditions forged in artisan steel & and a powerful music transcending language? The same place with a picnic table boat and two James Beard award-winning bakeries.
